b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (11:53): is it possible to define width: 100%-100px?
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:02): instead you just give no width: so the element takes default max possible
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:02): and give it a right or left (or both) margin

a6cb6d327d3a5f1e4173095a09598f13 (12:05): is there something similar to "white-space:nowrap" like "dowrap", so that it automaticaly wraps a long word (or a combination of characters without spaces) and doesn't overflow out of a block element?
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:05): Lashknife_: i try to fix that last green one http://wiki2.derkunde.de/index.php/Felix_Wuttke
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:06): daha, you can't break continuous strings
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:06): there's a php function to break at a particular amount of chars
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:07): but no easy way in html
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:07): you might want to look up also on js regexp and as such get positions of words that are above a particular length in size in your document
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:08): but that's kind of a really big job having to parse every elements content through dom
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:08): scott7 what's it supposed to look like?
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:09): your content asks for a dl-dt-dd list
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:09): not for some spans and br's
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:12): Lashknife_: lol i didn't even know dl-dt-dd, wow.
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:12): i just float that spans
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:12): there is a wonderful tag called <label for="id_of_element">
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:12): and that can be floated to (in order to make a tableless form design for example)
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:13): is label not only for forms?
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:13): i could also use a table :/
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:13): attach it to anything that needs to be labeled
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:13): but you could try otherwise first :)
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:14): i just want that it doesnt break to the next line
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:14): (remark: i don't know how flexible wiki framework is eh)
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:14): what do you mean by break?
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:14): oh very: i got my custom skin
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:15): like you would float the image to make the content go around it
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:19): because float is that if it is too large to go next to an element
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:19): the entire floated area goes below
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:19): so if i enlarge my browser to the width of 2 monitors
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:19): the green bar goes nicely next to "bemerkungen"
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:20): so the code is correct, only your interpretation isn't
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:20): same would happen if you make your window smaller so he name and vorname content floats below too
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:23): i implemented that p-span-content-p thing now.
b8e0a7f36bde05cd1d0ccd291dbab156 (12:24): somehow the floating elements snap to the above p if it is "empty"
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (12:27): daha, think you highlighted the incorrect L nickname :)
